gcci.text: At $3.15/hr for an H100, utilization and capex are tightly coupled—supply constraints keep chip availability tight, meaning only the most ROI-positive workloads justify expansion and inventory turns remain slow.

gtpi.text: At $1.25 per 1M input tokens, the API market is in a price war; margins are compressing toward low single digits, so providers must push inference efficiency and model compression to sustain profitability.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load intensifies grid strain in AI hubs and accelerates the shift to nuclear and firm renewables to manage carbon intensity and reliability.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment is cautiously optimistic, but overcapacity risks, rising energy costs, and cooling constraints keep growth sustainability under scrutiny.
